alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 2:02AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Fayette, Lamar, Marion, Walker and Winston. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 202 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jasper, Winfield, Fayette, Carbon Hill, Lynn, Arley, Guin, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Kansas, Nauvoo, Beaverton, Gu-Win, Eldridge, Ashbank, Poplar Springs, Camp McDowell, Bluff, Corinth Rec Area and Blooming Grove.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
